data.title: Italian Cinema: Roberto Rossellini
data.meta_description: Sunday 01/28/2024 @ 4:30 pm - 6:00 pm - Join us for screenings of timeless masterpieces: Roberto Rossellini’s ‘Paisá (1946),’ Michelangelo Antonioni’s ‘Blow Up (1966)’ and Lina Wertmüller’s ‘Seven Beauties (1975).’
data.text:
Date/Time

Sunday 01/28/2024

4:30 pm - 6:00 pm

Location

Museo Italo Americano

Categories

Film & Book Presentations

Step into the captivating world of Italian Cinema with a three-movie series at the Museo Italo Americano. Join us for screenings of timeless masterpieces: Roberto Rossellini’s ‘Paisá (1946),’ Michelangelo Antonioni’s ‘Blow Up (1966)’ and Lina Wertmüller’s ‘Seven Beauties (1975).’

Led by the insightful professor Dominic Angerame, each workshop delves into masterpieces of Italian Cinema. Across three sessions, we will unravel the cinematic brilliance of Roberto Rossellini, Michangelo Antonioni, and Lina Wertmüller. Together, we’ll dissect their filmic techniques, explore the profound themes, and ponder the implications embedded in their works.

Prepare to experience these films, their profound socio-historical significance, and their artistic vision.

In the upcoming session, Dominic Angerame will present ‘Paisá’ by Roberto Rossellini. This cinematic gem unfolds the story of Italy’s liberation by the Allied forces, revealed through six independent episodes.

Cost of the Event:Members Free | Non-Members $15

Secure your ticket today and join us on an immersive journey through the heart of Italian Cinema.

Bookings
